DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text criteria or questions included in an infection assessment/questionnaire.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Assessment or evaluation of an individual for past/present infections.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: general term for invasion and growth of microorganisms in bodily tissues.

Concepts.definition: general term for invasion and growth of microorganisms in bodily tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text criteria or questions included in an infection assessment/questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Conjunctivitis or Eye Infection
Ear Infection
Head Cold or Sinus Infection
Active Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV)

PermissibleValues.value: Active Chicken Pox, Herpes Zoster, or Varicella Zoster (VZV, Shingles)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Active Chicken Pox, Herpes Zoster, or Varicella Zoster (VZV, Shingles)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Active Chicken Pox, Herpes Zoster, or Varicella Zoster (VZV, Shingles)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Active Chicken Pox, Herpes Zoster, or Varicella Zoster (VZV, Shingles)

An acute, acute and chronic, or chronic inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, due to infections (viruses, fungi, mycoplasma, or bacteria), treatment (e.g. radiation), or exposure (inhalation) to chemicals. Symptoms include cough, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, chest pain, headache, sweating, and weakness.

Concepts.definition: An acute, acute and chronic, or chronic inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, due to infections (viruses, fungi, mycoplasma, or bacteria), treatment (e.g. radiation), or exposure (inhalation) to chemicals. Symptoms include cough, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, chest pain, headache, sweating, and weakness.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 11.19.2020 Updated concept annotation and long name to current NCIt . mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pneumocystis Carinii (PCP) Infection
An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the bronchi.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the bronchi.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 5/17/23 Added C2911 per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bacterial Infection in the Blood
Active CMV (Cytomegalovirus) Infection
Inflammation of the liver and liver disease involving degenerative or necrotic alterations of hepatocytes.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the liver; usually from a viral infection, but sometimes from toxic agents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Yeast Infection in the Mouth
Yeast Infection in the Vagina (Women)
Fungus (Yeast or Mold) Infection anywhere but the mouth and vagina
Meningitis
Catheter Infection
cellulitis

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by a bacterial infection. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain to the affected area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of very similar Mycobacteria consisting of Mycobacterium avium and M. intracellulare.

Concepts.definition: A group of very similar Mycobacteria consisting of Mycobacterium avium and M. intracellulare.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A common bacterial species found especially on nasal mucous membrane and skin (hair follicles); bacterial species that produces exotoxins including those that cause toxic shock syndrome, with resulting skin rash, and renal, hepatic, and central nervous system disease, and an enterotoxin associated with food poisoning; it causes furunculosis, cellulitis, pyemia, pneumonia, osteomyelitis, endocarditis, suppuration of wounds, other infections; also a cause of infection in burn patients; humans are the chief reservoir.

Concepts.definition: A common bacterial species found especially on nasal mucous membrane and skin (hair follicles); bacterial species that produces exotoxins including those that cause toxic shock syndrome, with resulting skin rash, and renal, hepatic, and central nervous system disease, and an enterotoxin associated with food poisoning; it causes furunculosis, cellulitis, pyemia, pneumonia, osteomyelitis, endocarditis, suppuration of wounds, other infections; also a cause of infection in burn patients; humans are the chief reservoir.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A negative-sense, enveloped RNA virus. The virion is variable in shape and size  with an average diameter of between 120 and 300 nm.

Concepts.definition: A negative-sense, enveloped RNA virus. The virion is variable in shape and size with an average diameter of between 120 and 300 nm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Infections with bacteria of the genus HAEMOPHILUS.

Concepts.definition: An infection that is caused by the organism Hemophilus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An infectious process affecting the upper respiratory tract (nose, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, larynx, or trachea). Symptoms include congestion, sneezing, coughing, fever, and sore throat.

Concepts.definition: An infectious process affecting the upper respiratory tract (nose, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, larynx, or trachea). Symptoms include congestion, sneezing, coughing, fever, and sore throat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans.

Concepts.definition: A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. 11.24.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic infectious process affecting the mucous membranes of the paranasal sinuses.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the mucous membranes of any sinus cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A negative-strand linear single-strand RNA virus with an 8 segment genome. Virions are enveloped and usually spherical or pleomorphic, 80-120 nm in diameter. Subtyping is based on the antigenic properties of the hemagglutinin and neuraminidase proteins. Influenza type A viruses can infect people, birds, pigs, horses, and other animals, but wild birds are the natural hosts for these viruses.

Concepts.definition: A negative-strand linear single-strand RNA virus with an 8 segment genome. Virions are enveloped and usually spherical or pleomorphic, 80-120 nm in diameter. Subtyping is based on the antigenic properties of the hemagglutinin and neuraminidase proteins. Influenza type A viruses can infect people, birds, pigs, horses, and other animals, but wild birds are the natural hosts for these viruses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.

Concepts.definition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: No Value Exists

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inflammatory disorder that affects the upper and lower gastrointestinal tract. Most commonly, this is attributed to viruses; however bacteria, parasites or adverse reactions can also be the culprit. Symptoms include acute diarrhea and vomiting.

Concepts.definition: An inflammatory disorder that affects the upper and lower gastrointestinal tract. Most commonly, this is attributed to viruses; however bacteria, parasites or adverse reactions can also be the culprit. Symptoms include acute diarrhea and vomiting.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Infection occurring at the site of a surgical incision.

Concepts.definition: Infection of a surgical incision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute, spreading infection of the deep tissues of the skin and muscle that causes the skin to become warm and tender and may also cause fever, chills, swollen lymph nodes, and blisters.: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by a bacterial infection. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain to the affected area.
A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the ear, which may be marked by pain, fever, abnormalities of hearing, hearing loss, tinnitus, and vertigo. Inflammation of the external ear is OTITIS EXTERNA; of the middle ear, OTITIS MEDIA; of the inner ear, LABYRINTHITIS. (From Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: A viral or bacterial infection that affects the external, middle, or inner ear.  It may follow an upper respiratory infection.  Signs and symptoms include pain, ear discharge, ear fullness, hearing loss, vertigo, nausea, and vomiting.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the peritoneum (tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen). Peritonitis can result from infection, injury, or certain diseases. Symptoms may include swelling of the abdomen, severe pain, and weight loss.: Of, or related to, the abdomen.: Accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection.: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the peritoneum due to infection by bacteria or fungi. Causes include liver disease, perforation of the gastrointestinal tract or biliary tract, and peritoneal dialysis. Patients usually present with abdominal pain and tenderness, fever, chills, and nausea and vomiting. It is an emergency medical condition that requires prompt medical attention and treatment.
Of, or related to, the abdomen.

An inflammatory process characterized by the accumulation of pus within a newly formed tissue cavity which is the result of a bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection or the presence of a foreign body.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the lungs.: Bacterial infectious process with formation of mucopurulent membranes affecting the trachea. Causative agents include Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, Haemophilus influenzae, Pseudomonas, and Klebsiella.: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Concepts.definition: An acute, acute and chronic, or chronic inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, due to infections (viruses, fungi, mycoplasma, or bacteria), treatment (e.g. radiation), or exposure (inhalation) to chemicals. Symptoms include cough, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, chest pain, headache, sweating, and weakness.

Bacterial infectious process with formation of mucopurulent membranes affecting the trachea. Causative agents include Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, Haemophilus influenzae, Pseudomonas, and Klebsiella.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: The words of something written.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
